info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-fw-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for ZBFW operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2018-2020, 2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Other Services
**Paths:** 6

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-fw-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-fw-oper.yang)

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-fw-oper structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-fw-oper.html)

catch-all.description: Total packet drops seen since bring up

l4-max-halfsession.description: Packet drops due to maximum L4 half-open sessions reached

l4-too-many-pkts.description: Packet drops due to exceeding the maximum number of inspectable packets allowed per flow

l4-session-limit.description: Packet drops for session initiators after exceeding maximum session limit

l4-invalid-hdr.description: Packet drops due to invalid header/packet length

l4-internal-err-undefined-dir.description: Packet drops due to a failure in determining direction

l4-scb-close.description: Packet drops due to session in internal close state

l4-tcp-invalid-ack-flag.description: Packet drops due to invalid TCP ACK flags

l4-tcp-invalid-ack-num.description: Packet drops due to invalid ACK number

l4-tcp-invalid-tcp-initiator.description: Packet drops due to non-SYN packets received without valid session

l4-tcp-syn-with-data.description: Packet drops due to SYN packets having data

l4-tcp-invalid-win-scale-option.description: Packet drops due to invalid TCP window scale option

l4-tcp-invalid-seg-synsent-state.description: Packet drops due to invalid packets received in SYNSENT state

l4-tcp-invalid-seg-synrcvd-state.description: Packet drops due to invalid packets received in SYNRCVD state

l4-tcp-invalid-seg-pkt-too-old.description: Packet drops due to packets being too old/out of window

l4-tcp-invalid-seg-pkt-win-overflow.description: Packet drops due to receiver window overflow (except when vTCP is enabled)

l4-tcp-invalid-seg-pyld-after-fin-send.description: Packet drops due to payload received after FIN is sent

l4-tcp-invalid-flags.description: Packet drops due to invalid/unexpected TCP flags

l4-tcp-invalid-seq.description: Packet drops due to invalid sequence number

l4-tcp-retrans-invalid-flags.description: Packet drops due to invalid flags in TCP retransmitted packet

l4-tcp-l7-ooo-seg.description: Packet drops due to L7 not accepting out-of-order TCP segments

l4-tcp-syn-flood-drop.description: Packet drops during SYN flood attack

l4-tcp-internal-err-synflood-alloc-hostd.description: Packet drops due to failure of hostdb allocation during a SYN flood attack

l4-tcp-synflood-blackout-drop.description: Packet drops due to blackout drop time when exceeding configured half-open connections

l4-tcp-unexpect-tcp-payload.description: Packet drops due to receiving TCP packet with payload when a response is expected for SYN

l4-tcp-syn-in-win.description: Packet drops due to receiving SYN in an established connection

l4-tcp-rst-in-win.description: Packet drops due to receiving RST in an established connection

l4-tcp-stray-seg.description: Packet drops due to unexpected/stray TCP segments

l4-tcp-rst-to-resp.description: RST sent to responder in SYNSENT state when ACK sequence is invalid

insp-pam-lookup-fail.description: Packet drops when policy exists in zone-pair but PAM lookup fails

insp-internal-err-get-stat-blk-fail.description: Packet drops due to failure to get statistics block

insp-dstaddr-lookup-fail.description: Packet drops due to destination address lookup failure

insp-policy-not-present.description: Packet drops due to inspection policy not present in zone-pair

insp-sess-miss-policy-not-present.description: Packet drops due to session lookup failure and no matching policy present

insp-classification-fail.description: Packet drops due to protocol classification failure

insp-class-action-drop.description: Packet drops due to a drop classification action

insp-policy-misconfigure.description: Packet drops due to failed classification because of misconfigured security policy

l4-icmp-too-many-err-pkts.description: Packet drops after exceeding the maximum number of ICMP error packets allowed per flow

l4-icmp-internal-err-no-nat.description: Packet drops when ICMP is network address translated without internal NAT info

l4-icmp-internal-err-alloc-fail.description: Packet drops when ICMP failed to get error packets

l4-icmp-internal-err-get-stat-blk-fail.description: Packet drops due to a failure to get statistics block

l4-icmp-internal-err-dir-not-identified.description: Packet drops due to unidentified ICMP packet direction

l4-icmp-scb-close.description: Packet drops due to receiving ICMP packets when session is in internal close state

l4-icmp-pkt-no-ip-hdr.description: Packet drops due to missing IP header in ICMP packets

l4-icmp-pkt-too-short.description: Packet drops due to ICMP error where packets are too short

l4-icmp-err-no-ip-no-icmp.description: Packet drops due to packets not identified as IP or ICMP

l4-icmp-err-pkts-burst.description: Packet drops due to ICMP error where packet bursts exceed a limit of 10

l4-icmp-err-multiple-unreach.description: Packet drops due to receiving multiple unreachable packets; only 1 is allowed

l4-icmp-err-l4-invalid-seq.description: Packet drops when inner TCP sequence number of packet does not match that of packet originating the ICMP error

l4-icmp-err-l4-invalid-ack.description: Packet drops due to inner TCP header invalid ACK

l4-icmp-err-policy-not-present.description: Packet drops due to missing policy on zone-pair for ICMP

l4-icmp-err-classification-fail.description: Packet drops due to a miss when doing reverse path flow check

syncookie-max-dst.description: SYNcookie Packet drops when we've reached maximum number of SYN destinations per zone

syncookie-internal-err-alloc-fail.description: SYNcookie Packet drops due to a failure in allocating memory in the destination table

syncookie-trigger.description: Packet drops due to a SYNcookie trigger

policy-fragment-drop.description: Packet drops due to dropping fragmented packet when first fragment drops

policy-action-drop.description: Packet drops when policy action is drop

policy-icmp-action-drop.description: Packet drops when policy action for the ICMP packet is to drop

l7-type-drop.description: Packet drops when L7 inspection returns drop as the action

l7-no-seg.description: Packet drops due to receiving segmented packets when ALG does not honor them

l7-no-frag.description: Packet drops due to receiving fragmented packets when ALG does not honor them

l7-unknown-proto.description: Packet drops due to unrecognized L7 protocol type

l7-alg-ret-drop.description: Packet drops due to L7 (ALG) deciding to drop the packet

l7-promote-fail-no-zone-pair.description: Packet drops due to L7 sub-channel promotion failure due to no zone pair configured for the sub-channel

l7-promote-fail-no-policy.description: Packet drops due to L7 sub-channel promotion failure due to no policy configured for the sub-channel

no-session.description: Packet drops due to session creation failure

no-new-session.description: Packet drops due to internal state not allowing new session creation

not-initiator.description: Packet drops due to receiving a non-initiator packet for a session

ha-ar-standby.description: Packet drops due to asymmetric routing not configured and box not in active state

no-forwarding-zone.description: Packet drops when Firewall is uninitialized

backpressure.description: Packet drops due to backpressure by log mechanism

zone-mismatch.description: Packet drops due to zone mismatch

fdb-err.description: Packet drops due to a failure to register flow with flow database

tags.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for ZBFW operational data.
